<summary><b>Figure 1 -</b> Figure about two different models NLP by Oscar and me</summary>

```{r figure, echo=FALSE, fig.height=5, fig.width=17, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
data <- read.xlsx("results_for_graph.xlsx")
data$` ` <- paste(rep("                                 ", nrow(data)))
colnames(data) <- c("outcome", "ca_method", "model", "mean", "low", "up", "p_value", '')
na_row <- rep('', ncol(data))
na_row <- data.frame('','', '','','','','','')
colnames(na_row) <- c("outcome", "ca_method", "model", "mean", "low", "up", "p_value", '')
data <- rbind(data[c(1:5),], na_row, data[c(6:10),])
data$mean_ic <- paste0(data$mean, " (", data$low, " to ", data$up, ")")
tm <- forest_theme(ci_pch = 19)
data$mean <- as.numeric(data$mean)
data$low <- as.numeric(data$low)
data$up <- as.numeric(data$up)
p <- forest(data[,c(1:3, 8:9)],
               est = data$mean,
               lower = data$low, 
               upper = data$up, 
               sizes = 1,
               ci_column = 4,
               ref_line = 0, 
               xlim = NULL,
               ticks_at = NULL,
            theme = tm)
plot <- plot(p)

plot
```
